event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: An unexpected trap with some unknown cause was detected by a CPU chip during POST.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
Unexpected trap with some unknown cause was detected by a CPU chip during POST.

The domain is reset, but nothing is deconfigured.


The system administrator should:

   Examine output displayed to the XSCF console and XSCF logs files to identify if a fault had occurred;

       XSCF> fmdump -m
       XSCF> fmdump -v
   
  
   If the problem persists, proceed with the steps outlined below.


       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:01:39 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: a4f2eebe-1940-476f-8265-d0b53c66ce06
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8000-QS for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8000-QS, TYPE: upset, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:01:39 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: a4f2eebe-1940-476f-8265-d0b53c66ce06
   DESC: An unexpected trap with some unknown cause was detected by a CPU chip during POST.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8000-QS for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Nothing is deconfigured.
   IMPACT: The domain is reset.
   REC-ACTION: Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
 

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u a4f2eebe-1940-476f-8265-d0b53c66ce06

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:01:39.1986 a4f2eebe-1940-476f-8265-d0b53c66ce06 SCF-8000-QS
           100%  upset.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.cpu.SPARC64-VI.fe-unexpected-trap

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0
                    Affects: -
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0/component=CHASSIS


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.
